Name: indexrelid
Description: the oid of the pg_class entry for this index

Name: indrelid
Description: the oid of the pg_class entry for the table this index is for

Name: indnatts
Description: the number of columns in the index (duplicates pg_class.relnatts)

Name: indisunique
Description: if true, this is a unique index.

Name: indisprimary
Description: if true, this index represents the primary key of the table. (indisunique should always be true when this is true.)

Name: indisclustered
Description: if true, the table was last clustered on this index.

Name: indkey
Description: this is an array of indnatts values that indicate which table columns this index indexes. for example a value of 1 3 would mean that the first and the third table columns make up the index key. a zero in this array indicates that the corresponding index attribute is an expression over the table columns, rather than a simple column reference.

Name: indclass
Description: for each column in the index key this contains the oid of the operator class to use. see pg_opclass for details.

Name: indexprs
Description: expression trees (in nodetostring() representation) for index attributes that are not simple column references. this is a list with one element for each zero entry in indkey. null if all index attributes are simple references.

Name: indpred
Description: expression tree (in nodetostring() representation) for partial index predicate. null if not a partial index.
